Sentencas: This paper examines the arrangement of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) within a coal gasification cycle, this combination generally being called an integrated gasification fuel cell cycle.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: This work relies on a previous study performed by the National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) that details thermodynamic simulations of integrated gasification combined cycle (IGCC) systems and considers various gasifier types and includes cases for 90% CO(2) capture (2007, Cost and Performance Baseline for Fossil Energy Plants, Vol.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: 1: Bituminous Coal and Natural Gas to Electricity, National Energy Technology Laboratory Report No.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems
Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: All systems in this study assume a Conoco Philips gasifier and cold-gas clean up conditions for the coal gasification system (Cases 3 and 4 in the NETL IGCC report).
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Four system arrangements, cases, are examined.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Cases 1 and 2 remove the CO(2) after the SOFC anode.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Case 3 assumes steam addition, a water-gas-shift (WGS) catalyst, and a Selexol process to remove the CO(2) in the gas cleanup section, sending a hydrogen-rich gas to the fuel cell anode.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Case 4 assumes Selexol in the cold-gas cleanup section as in Case 3; however, there is no steam addition, and the WGS takes places in the SOFC and after the anode.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Results demonstrate significant efficiency advantages compared with IGCC with CO(2) capture.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: The hydrogen-rich case (Case 3) has better net electric efficiency compared with typical postanode CO(2) capture cases (Cases 1 and 2), with a simpler arrangement but at a lower SOFC power density, or a lower efficiency at the same power density.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Case 4 gives an efficiency similar to Case 3 but also at a lower SOFC power density.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems

Sentencas: Carbon deposition concerns are also discussed.
Titulo: Comparison of Preanode and Postanode Carbon Dioxide Separation for IGFC Systems
